result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Deferred Judgement agreement
Diversion Agreement
Diversion Agreement

11:01 AM Defendant LARRY N. WYNVEEN in court.  Attorney Alf Langan in court for LARRY N. WYNVEEN.  Prosecuting attorney Laura Nelson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters Guilty plea to count 1. Count 2 will be dismissed. Court advises party of their rights, finds factual basis, accepts defendant's waiver of their rights, the plea made, and withholds finding Defendant guilty. State and Defense make sentencing recommendation. Court accepts Diversion Agreement.

11:45 AM  Defendant LARRY N. WYNVEEN appeared by video.  Attorney Alf Langan in court for LARRY N. WYNVEEN.  Attorney Laura Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin.
Court questions why DE is appearing via Zoom.  Atty Langan - filed motion, was waiting for response from Judge.  State does not object.  PLQ filed w/guilty plea to Count 1.  ADA Nelson moves to dismiss Count 2.  Court reviews right of DE to appear in person. DE agrees to appear remotely.  ADA Nelson - Deferred Judgment Agreement - 12 months, complete AODA and Anger Mgmt assessments , absolute sobriety., if successfully completed, will dismiss Count 1 w/o costs. Court questions DE, has concerns w/answers provided.  Court feels PLEAS should be continued to allow DE to appear in person.  PLEAS set for Oct. 20, 2022 @ 11AM.

3:56 PM. Defendant LARRY N. WYNVEEN in court with attorney Alf Langan.  ADA Laura Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionaire and waiver of rights signed by the defendant.  Court gives defendant his rights. Court accepts the PH waiver, finds p/c and binds the matter over for ARGN. Atty. Langan addresses the Court. ADA Nelson/Atty. Langan have an agreement that with the PH waiver the defendant won't have any "repeater" enhancements added to his charges. Atty. Nelson confirms. 
ARGN is set for: 03-23-2022 at 1:30pm.

Atty Langan - DE was hospitalized, believes per family he may be released by end of week.  ADA Nelson - no objection to adjournment.  Court will continue, questions scheduling.
